AccessTokenInput.title: AccessTokenInput
AccessTokenInput.description: Input for creating a service account access token

AgentRun.title: AgentRun
AgentRun.description: An execution of an AI coding agent processing a prompt against a repository

branch.description: The git branch the agent is operating on (uses default branch if not set)

error.description: Error message if the agent run failed

flow_id.description: ID of the flow this agent run is associated with, if any

id.description: Unique identifier for the agent run

language.description: Programming language used in the agent run (javascript, python, java, cpp, csharp, go, ruby, php, terraform)

language_version.description: Specific version of the programming language to use

mode.description: Mode of the agent run (analyze for read-only analysis, write for code modifications)

prompt.description: The prompt given to the AI agent to process

repository.description: The git repository URL the agent is working on

runtime_id.description: ID of the runtime executing this agent run

shared.description: Whether this agent run is shared publicly

status.description: Current status of the agent run (pending, running, successful, failed, cancelled)

user_id.description: ID of the user who initiated this agent run

AgentRunInput.title: AgentRunInput
AgentRunInput.description: Input for creating a new agent run to execute an AI coding agent

flow_id.description: Optional flow ID to associate this agent run with

mode.description: Mode of the agent run (analyze for read-only, write for modifications)

prompt.description: The prompt to give to the agent describing the task to perform

repository.description: The git repository URL the agent will work on (https or ssh format)

runtime_id.description: The runtime ID to execute the agent run on

shared.description: Whether to share this agent run publicly

AgentRuntime.title: AgentRuntime
AgentRuntime.description: An agent runtime configured on a cluster for executing AI coding agents

ai_proxy.description: Whether this runtime uses the built-in Plural AI proxy for LLM requests

allowed_repositories.description: The git repositories allowed to be used with this runtime

cluster_id.description: ID of the cluster this runtime is deployed on

default.description: Whether this is the default runtime for coding agents

id.description: Unique identifier for the agent runtime

type.description: Type of agent runtime (claude, opencode, gemini, custom)

AgentSession.title: AgentSession
AgentSession.description: An autonomous AI agent session working on infrastructure tasks

branch.description: The git branch this session's pull request is operating on

cluster_id.description: ID of the cluster associated with this session

commit_count.description: Number of commits made by this agent session

connection_id.description: ID of the cloud connection used by this session

done.description: Whether the agent has declared the work for this session complete

id.description: Unique identifier for the agent session

initialized.description: Whether the agent session has been initialized

plan_confirmed.description: Whether the provisioning plan has been confirmed by the user

prompt.description: The prompt given to the agent

pull_request_id.description: ID of the pull request created by this session

service_id.description: ID of the service associated with this session

stack_id.description: ID of the infrastructure stack associated with this session

thread_id.description: ID of the chat thread associated with this session

type.description: Type of agent session (terraform, kubernetes, provisioning, search, manifests, chat, research)

AgentSessionInput.title: AgentSessionInput
AgentSessionInput.description: Input for creating a new agent session to execute autonomous infrastructure tasks

cluster_id.description: ID of the cluster to use for this session

connection_id.description: ID of the cloud connection to use for this session

done.description: Whether to immediately mark this session as done

plan_confirmed.description: Whether the provisioning plan is pre-confirmed

prompt.description: The prompt describing the task for the agent to perform

Cascade.title: Cascade
Cascade.description: Cascade behavior when the global service is deleted

delete.description: If true, cascade delete all services owned by this global service

detach.description: If true, immediately detach services from the database without draining

CascadeInput.title: CascadeInput
CascadeInput.description: Input for cascade behavior when the global service is deleted

delete.description: If true, cascade delete all services owned by this global service

detach.description: If true, immediately detach services from the database without draining

Catalog.title: Catalog
Catalog.description: A catalog of PR automations for self-service deployment workflows

author.description: Author or maintainer of the catalog

category.description: Category for organizing catalogs (e.g., infrastructure, applications)

dark_icon.description: URL or reference to the catalog's icon for dark mode

description.description: Description of the catalog's purpose and contents

icon.description: URL or reference to the catalog's icon for light mode

id.description: Unique identifier for the catalog

project_id.description: ID of the project this catalog belongs to

CatalogInput.title: CatalogInput
CatalogInput.description: Input for creating or updating a catalog

author.description: Author or maintainer of the catalog

dark_icon.description: URL or reference to the catalog's icon for dark mode

icon.description: URL or reference to the catalog's icon for light mode

project_id.description: ID of the project this catalog belongs to

Cluster.title: Cluster
Cluster.description: A Kubernetes cluster that can be deployed to and managed through the platform

tags.description: Key/value tags to filter and organize clusters

availability_zones.description: The availability zones this cluster is running in

cpu_total.description: The total CPU capacity of the cluster in cores

cpu_util.description: The current CPU utilization of the cluster as a percentage

current_version.description: Current Kubernetes version as reported by the deployment operator

deleted_at.description: Timestamp when this cluster was scheduled for deletion

distro.description: The distribution of kubernetes this cluster is running (generic, eks, aks, gke, rke, k3s, openshift)

handle.description: A short, unique human readable name used to identify this cluster

id.description: Unique identifier for the cluster

installed.description: Whether the deploy operator has been registered for this cluster

kubelet_version.description: The lowest discovered kubelet version for all nodes in the cluster

memory_total.description: The total memory capacity of the cluster in bytes

memory_util.description: The current memory utilization of the cluster as a percentage

metadata.description: Arbitrary JSON metadata to store user-specific state of this cluster

name.description: Human readable name of this cluster, will also translate to cloud k8s name

namespace_count.description: The number of namespaces in this cluster

node_count.description: The number of nodes in this cluster

openshift_version.description: The version of OpenShift this cluster is running, if applicable

pinged_at.description: Timestamp of the last ping from the deploy operator

pod_count.description: The number of pods in this cluster

project_id.description: ID of the project this cluster belongs to

protect.description: If true, this cluster cannot be deleted

self.description: Whether this is the management cluster itself

version.description: Desired Kubernetes version for the cluster

virtual.description: Whether this is a virtual cluster

ClusterInput.title: ClusterInput
ClusterInput.description: Input for creating or updating a cluster

tags.description: Key/value tags to filter and organize clusters

handle.description: A short, unique human readable name used to identify this cluster

metadata.description: Arbitrary JSON metadata to store user-specific state

name.description: Human readable name for the cluster

project_id.description: ID of the project this cluster belongs to

ClusterUpgrade.title: ClusterUpgrade
ClusterUpgrade.description: An agentic workflow for upgrading a cluster

cluster_id.description: ID of the cluster being upgraded

id.description: Unique identifier for the cluster upgrade

prompt.description: Prompt used to generate the upgrade workflow

runtime_id.description: ID of the agent runtime executing the upgrade

status.description: Status of the upgrade (pending, in_progress, completed, failed)

steps.description: Steps that make up this upgrade workflow

user_id.description: ID of the user who initiated the upgrade

version.description: Target Kubernetes version for this upgrade

ClusterUpgradeInput.title: ClusterUpgradeInput
ClusterUpgradeInput.description: Input for creating a cluster upgrade workflow

prompt.description: Optional prompt to guide the upgrade workflow

runtime_id.description: Optional agent runtime ID to execute the upgrade

ClusterUpgradeStep.title: ClusterUpgradeStep
ClusterUpgradeStep.description: A step in an agentic cluster upgrade workflow

agent_run_id.description: ID of the agent run associated with this step, if any

error.description: Error message if the step failed

id.description: Unique identifier for the upgrade step

prompt.description: Prompt used to generate the upgrade step

status.description: Status of the step (pending, in_progress, completed, failed)

upgrade_id.description: ID of the cluster upgrade this step belongs to

Console.OpenAPI.AI.AgentRun.List.description: A paginated list of agent runs

Console.OpenAPI.AI.AgentRuntime.List.description: A paginated list of agent runtimes

Console.OpenAPI.AI.AgentSession.List.description: A paginated list of agent sessions

Console.OpenAPI.AI.SentinelRun.List.description: A paginated list of sentinel runs

Console.OpenAPI.AI.WorkbenchJob.List.description: A paginated list of workbench jobs

Console.OpenAPI.AccessToken.Scope.description: A scope entry for an access token

Console.OpenAPI.CD.GlobalService.List.description: A paginated list of global services

Console.OpenAPI.CD.Service.List.description: A paginated list of service deployments

Console.OpenAPI.SCM.PrAutomation.List.description: A paginated list of PR automations

Console.OpenAPI.SCM.PullRequest.List.description: A paginated list of pull requests

CreatePullRequestInput.title: CreatePullRequestInput
CreatePullRequestInput.description: Input for creating a pull request using a PR automation

branch.description: Branch name for the pull request (overrides default)

context.description: Context variables to pass to the PR automation templates

error.description: The error message for the git repository's last pull attempt

https_path.description: The https url for this git repo if you need to customize it

pulled_at.description: The last successful git pull timestamp

url.description: The url of the git repository, can be either an https or ssh url

url_format.description: A format string to get the http url for a subfolder in a git repo

GitRepositoryInput.title: GitRepositoryInput
GitRepositoryInput.description: Input for creating or updating a git repository

connection_id.description: The id of the scm connection to use for authentication

passphrase.description: A passphrase to decrypt the given private key

password.description: The http password for http authenticated repos

private_key.description: An ssh private key to use with this repo if an ssh url was given

url.description: The url of the git repository, can be either an https or ssh url

username.description: The http username for authenticated http repos, defaults to apiKey for github

private_key.description: The private key for the GitHub App

GlobalService.title: GlobalService
GlobalService.description: A global service that deploys services across clusters matching specified criteria

tags.description: Tags used to match target clusters

distro.description: Target cluster distribution (e.g., eks, aks, gke, generic)

id.description: Unique identifier for the global service

interval.description: Polling interval for syncing the global service (e.g., "5m", "1h")

mgmt.description: If true, the global service will target the management cluster

project_id.description: ID of the project this global service belongs to

provider_id.description: ID of the cluster provider to filter target clusters

reparent.description: If true, allows reparenting of existing services owned by this global service

service_id.description: ID of the source service to clone (mutually exclusive with template)

GlobalServiceInput.title: GlobalServiceInput
GlobalServiceInput.description: Input for creating or updating a global service

tags.description: Tags used to match target clusters

mgmt.description: If true, target the management cluster

project_id.description: ID of the project this global service belongs to

provider_id.description: ID of the cluster provider to filter target clusters

reparent.description: If true, allows reparenting of existing services

error.description: The error message for the helm repository's last pull attempt

url.description: The url of the helm repository

HelmRepositoryInput.title: HelmRepositoryInput
HelmRepositoryInput.description: Input for upserting a helm repository

auth.description: Authentication configuration for the helm repository

assume_role_arn.description: ARN of the role to assume

url.description: The url of the helm repository

HelmSpec.title: HelmSpec
HelmSpec.description: Helm chart configuration for a service

release.description: Helm release name for the deployment

repository_id.description: ID of the Helm repository for this chart

url.description: URL of the Helm chart repository

values.description: Inline helm values for the helm chart

chart.description: Name of the Helm chart to deploy

repository_id.description: ID of a GitRepository to use for sourcing this helm chart

values.description: YAML configuration values for the Helm chart

values_files.description: List of referenced values.yaml files to be used with the chart

enable_helm.description: If true, Helm integration is enabled for Kustomize

path.description: Path to the kustomization.yaml or kustomize directory relative to the repository root

enable_helm.description: Enable Helm support within Kustomize if true

path.description: Path to the kustomization.yaml or kustomize directory

Pipeline.title: Pipeline
Pipeline.description: A continuous deployment pipeline that orchestrates service promotions through stages

edges.description: Edges connecting stages with promotion gates

id.description: Unique identifier for the pipeline

project_id.description: ID of the project this pipeline belongs to

stages.description: Ordered list of stages in this pipeline

PipelineContext.title: PipelineContext
PipelineContext.description: A context containing data for pipeline promotions and PR automations

context.description: Arbitrary key-value data map passed through the pipeline

id.description: Unique identifier for the context

pipeline_id.description: ID of the pipeline this context belongs to

PipelineContextInput.title: PipelineContextInput
PipelineContextInput.description: Input for creating a new pipeline context to trigger a pipeline run

context.description: Arbitrary key-value data map to pass through the pipeline for PR automations

PipelineEdge.title: PipelineEdge
PipelineEdge.description: An edge connecting two stages with optional promotion gates

gates.description: Gates that must be satisfied for promotion

id.description: Unique identifier for the edge

promoted_at.description: Timestamp when promotion last occurred through this edge

PipelineGate.title: PipelineGate
PipelineGate.description: A gate checkpoint for pipeline promotions

id.description: Unique identifier for the gate

state.description: Current state of the gate (pending, open, closed, running)

PipelineStage.title: PipelineStage
PipelineStage.description: A stage in the pipeline representing a deployment environment

id.description: Unique identifier for the stage

name.description: Name of the stage (e.g., dev, staging, production)

PrAutomation.title: PrAutomation
PrAutomation.description: A PR automation template for creating infrastructure or application pull requests

title.description: Title template for generated pull requests

addon.description: Name of the addon this PR automation is associated with, if any

branch.description: Default branch name for generated pull requests

catalog_id.description: ID of the catalog this PR automation belongs to

cluster_id.description: ID of the cluster this PR automation is associated with, if any

configuration.description: Configuration fields for the PR automation

connection_id.description: ID of the SCM connection used for creating pull requests

dark_icon.description: URL or reference to the PR automation's icon for dark mode

documentation.description: Documentation describing the PR automation's purpose and usage

icon.description: URL or reference to the PR automation's icon for light mode

id.description: Unique identifier for the PR automation

identifier.description: Repository identifier (e.g., owner/repo) for the PR automation

message.description: Message/body template for generated pull requests

project_id.description: ID of the project this PR automation belongs to

service_id.description: ID of the service this PR automation is associated with, if any

PrConfiguration.title: PrConfiguration
PrConfiguration.description: A configuration field for a PR automation

default.description: Default value for the configuration field

longform.description: Extended documentation for the configuration field

optional.description: Whether the configuration field is optional

placeholder.description: Placeholder text for the configuration field input

type.description: Type of the configuration field (string, int, bool, domain, file, function, enum, password)

PrConfigurationValidation.title: PrConfigurationValidation
PrConfigurationValidation.description: Validation rules for a configuration field

message.description: Error message to display when validation fails

Project.title: Project
Project.description: A project is a top-level organizational unit that groups related resources such as clusters, stacks, pipelines, and services

default.description: Whether this is the default project for the instance

description.description: A human-readable description of the project

id.description: The unique identifier of the project

PromotionCriteria.title: PromotionCriteria
PromotionCriteria.description: Criteria for promoting a service to the next stage

id.description: Unique identifier for the promotion criteria

pr_automation_id.description: ID of the PR automation to trigger on promotion

repository.description: Repository to create PRs against for promotion

PullRequest.title: PullRequest
PullRequest.description: A pull request reference tracked by the platform for deployment workflows

cluster_id.description: ID of the cluster this pull request is associated with, if any

creator.description: Username of the pull request creator in the source control provider

id.description: Unique identifier for the pull request record

labels.description: Labels applied to the pull request

ref.description: Git ref (branch name) for the pull request

service_id.description: ID of the service this pull request is associated with, if any

sha.description: Git SHA of the pull request head

stack_id.description: ID of the stack this pull request is associated with, if any

status.description: Current status of the pull request (open, merged, closed)

url.description: URL of the pull request in the source control provider

ignore_hooks.description: Whether to ignore Helm hooks when rendering

release.description: Helm release name to use when rendering

values.description: Helm values file content to use when rendering

values_files.description: List of relative paths to values files

RendererHelmInput.title: RendererHelmInput
RendererHelmInput.description: Helm-specific configuration input for a renderer

ignore_hooks.description: Whether to ignore Helm hooks when rendering

release.description: Helm release name to use when rendering

values.description: Helm values file content to use when rendering

values_files.description: List of relative paths to values files

ScmConnection.title: ScmConnection
ScmConnection.description: An SCM connection for integrating with source control providers

api_url.description: Base URL for HTTP APIs for self-hosted versions if different from base URL

base_url.description: Base URL for self-hosted versions of this provider

default.description: Whether this is the default SCM connection

name.description: The name of the SCM connection

ScmConnectionInput.title: ScmConnectionInput
ScmConnectionInput.description: Input for creating or updating an SCM connection

base_url.description: Base URL for Git clones for self-hosted versions

default.description: Whether this is the default SCM connection

name.description: The name of the SCM connection

signing_private_key.description: A private key used for signing commits

Sentinel.title: Sentinel
Sentinel.description: An automated monitoring system that runs checks against your infrastructure

checks.description: List of checks configured for this sentinel

description.description: Description of what this sentinel monitors

id.description: Unique identifier for the sentinel

last_run_at.description: Timestamp of when this sentinel was last executed

project_id.description: ID of the project this sentinel belongs to

repository_id.description: ID of the git repository for rule files

status.description: Status of the sentinel's last run (pending, success, failed)

SentinelCheck.title: SentinelCheck
SentinelCheck.description: A specific monitoring check within a sentinel

id.description: Unique identifier for the check

rule_file.description: Path to the rule file for this check within the repository

SentinelCheckResult.title: SentinelCheckResult
SentinelCheckResult.description: The result of a single check within a sentinel run

job_count.description: Total number of jobs spawned for this check

name.description: Name of the check that was executed

reason.description: Reason for failure if the check failed

status.description: Status of this check (pending, success, failed)

SentinelRun.title: SentinelRun
SentinelRun.description: A single execution of a sentinel's monitoring checks

id.description: Unique identifier for the sentinel run

jobs.description: Jobs spawned by this sentinel run for integration tests

results.description: Results of individual checks in this run

sentinel_id.description: ID of the sentinel that was executed

status.description: Current status of the run (pending, success, failed)

SentinelRunJob.title: SentinelRunJob
SentinelRunJob.description: An integration test job spawned by a sentinel run

check.description: Name of the check this job belongs to

cluster_id.description: ID of the cluster this job ran on

format.description: Output format of the job (plaintext, junit)

id.description: Unique identifier for the job

repository_id.description: ID of the git repository used for the test

sentinel_run_id.description: ID of the sentinel run this job belongs to

status.description: Current status of the job (pending, running, success, failed)

Service.title: Service
Service.description: A service deployment reference deployed from a git repo into a cluster

cluster_id.description: ID of the cluster this service is deployed to

component_status.description: Status message from components (e.g. unhealthy reason)

deleted_at.description: Timestamp the service was marked for deletion, if deleted

dry_run.description: If true, this service is running in dry-run mode

errors.description: List of errors generated by the deployment operator

id.description: Unique identifier for the service deployment

interval.description: Polling interval for the service reconcile loop (e.g., "5m")

message.description: Latest commit message from the synced revision

namespace.description: Kubernetes namespace where the service is deployed

protect.description: If true, prevents service deletion or config edits

renderers.description: Custom renderers for processing service manifests

repository_id.description: ID of the git or Helm repository backing this service

sha.description: Git commit SHA for the current synced revision.  This will be a helm digest if a pure helm chart as well

sources.description: Additional source repositories for this service

status.description: Current status of the service deployment (e.g., stale, synced, healthy, failed, paused)

templated.description: If true, the service was deployed using a template

ServiceConfigurationInput.title: ServiceConfigurationInput
ServiceConfigurationInput.description: A configuration key-value pair for a service deployment. These are used as templating values when rendering service manifests.

name.description: The name/key of the configuration value

value.description: The value for this configuration key. If null, will remove this value

ServiceError.title: ServiceError
ServiceError.description: An error reported by the deployment operator during service sync

message.description: Error message describing what went wrong

source.description: Source of the error (e.g., component name or sync stage)

warning.description: If true, this is a warning rather than a fatal error

ServiceInput.title: ServiceInput
ServiceInput.description: Input for creating or updating a service deployment

configuration.description: Configuration values to template into the service manifests. You must pass the full list of configuration inputs

dry_run.description: If true, does not actually apply any changes to the cluster

protect.description: If true, marks the service as protected from accidental changes

renderers.description: Custom renderers for processing service manifests

repository_id.description: ID of the backing repository for this service

sources.description: Additional source repositories for this service

ServiceRenderer.title: ServiceRenderer
ServiceRenderer.description: A custom renderer for processing service manifests at a specific path

path.description: Path within the repository where this renderer applies

type.description: Type of renderer (auto, raw, helm, kustomize)

ServiceRendererInput.title: ServiceRendererInput
ServiceRendererInput.description: Input for a custom renderer configuration

path.description: Path within the repository where this renderer applies

type.description: Type of renderer (auto, raw, helm, kustomize)

ServiceSource.title: ServiceSource
ServiceSource.description: An additional source repository for a service deployment

path.description: Subdirectory path where this source will live in the final tarball

repository_id.description: ID of the git repository to source from

ServiceSourceInput.title: ServiceSourceInput
ServiceSourceInput.description: Input for an additional source repository

path.description: Subdirectory path where this source will live in the final tarball

repository_id.description: ID of the git repository to source from

ServiceTemplate.title: ServiceTemplate
ServiceTemplate.description: A service template that defines how services are created from a global service

id.description: Unique identifier for the service template

name.description: Name of the service to be created from this template

protect.description: If true, prevents accidental deletion or modification of created services

templated.description: If true, the service configuration supports variable interpolation

ServiceTemplateInput.title: ServiceTemplateInput
ServiceTemplateInput.description: Input for a service template configuration

contexts.description: List of service context names to include

name.description: Name of the service to be created from this template

protect.description: If true, prevent accidental deletion or modification

repository_id.description: ID of the git repository backing this template

templated.description: If true, enable variable interpolation in service configuration

StageService.description: A service deployment within a pipeline stage

id.description: Unique identifier for the stage service

TagInput.description: A tag used for matching clusters

WorkbenchJob.description: A single run of a workbench

id.description: Unique identifier for the job

WorkbenchJobResultTodo.title: WorkbenchJobResultTodo

get.description: Returns a paginated list of all pipelines the authenticated user has access to
Retrieves a single pipeline by its unique identifier, including its stages, edges, and gates

post.description: Creates a new pipeline context to trigger a pipeline run. The context data flows through stages and can be used for PR automations.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of all projects the authenticated user has access to
Retrieves a single project by its unique identifier
